formattedAddress: 47 E 124th St, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 47 E 124th St, New York, NY 10035, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bright & cozy standby preparing Caribbean & Southern specialties & a signature pineapple cornbread.

originalText.text: I first came across this restaurant’s food at an event I attended.  A few of their dishes was a part of the catering.  Their food was absolutely delicious I had the yams, fried whitening fish, and collard greens.  Let me warn you if their collard greens were SPICY.   I don’t do spices.  Even many of the people who love spices also stated it was to spicy.  I was in the area and decided to order for lunch.  I visited the restaurant in October 2023.  I placed my order online so it could be ready for pick up when I arrived.  I was disappointed to learn the fried whiting fish is only available through their catering menu.   I decided to order the stewed chicken, coconut peas and rice, steamed cabbage, yams, macaroni & cheese, cornbread, and lemonade.  When I arrived to the restaurant, I noticed it’s not a sit-down restaurant.  Seems like you pick up and go.  I was greeted by staff told them I was picking up and they let me know my order was ready.  I was so eager to dig into my food.  I was expecting the Caribbean flavors and was let down and disappointed in my meal.  I even shared with my coworker for her opinion.   The best thing out of everything I ordered was the yams and lemonade.  The chicken was bland and had no flavor.  The peas and rice was okay.  The cabbage wasn’t cooked and still too crunchy again no seasoning/flavor.  The macaroni and cheese wasn’t good.  The cornbread was okay, it has pineapple in it.  I don’t think I’ll return and if I do it’ll only be for the yams and lemonade. This didn’t taste anything like Caribbean cuisine.  The portion of the food was also really small.  My total was about $36.00.  This location is accessible via public transportation.

originalText.text:
Cannot believe I've lived in Harlem for almost four years now and I just went here for the first time. Got the oxtail stew with rice & peas, and collard greens. Phenomenal. Their homemade lemonades were delicious. We also ordered the mac & cheese and candied yams as sides. But the real showstopper was the pineapple cornbread. Best cornbread I've had in Harlem. It's so moist and packed with flavor. Carrot cake was a great dessert to finish with. 10/10 will be going back and ordering for delivery.

I'm surprised they don't have a larger sit-down area. This food deserves the full dining experience!
